revisions.rev:
{{Infobox company | name = Westinghouse Digital LLC | logo = | caption = | type = [[Privately held company|Private]] (Licensee of [[Westinghouse Licensing|Westinghouse Electric Corporation]]) | fate = | predecessor = Westinghouse Digital Electronics, LLC | successor = | foundation = [[Orange, California]], [[United States|U.S.]] ({{Start Date|2003}}, as Westinghouse Digital Electronics, LLC) | founder = | defunct = | location_city = [[Orange, California]] | location_country = [[United States|U.S.]] | location = | locations = | area_served = Nationwide | key_people = Doug Woo, <small>President</small> | industry = [[Consumer electronics]] | products = Televisions | services = | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | aum = | assets = | equity = | owner = | num_employees = | parent = | divisions = | subsid = | homepage = {{URL|westinghousedigital.com}} | footnotes = | intl = }} '''Westinghouse Digital LLC''' is a US company that markets LCD televisions<ref>[http://www.wde.com Westinghouse Digital Official Site] Main Page</ref> and other flat-panel display products<ref>[http://dss.wde.com/ Westinghouse Digital Signage Solutions]</ref> located in [[Orange, California]].
It is one of the licensees of the [[Westinghouse Licensing|Westinghouse Electric Corporation]].<ref>[http://westinghousedigital.com/support/trademarks-terms-of-use/ Trademarks & Terms of Use] Westinghouse Digital Official Site</ref>
==History== The company was founded as Golden Star Electronics LLC to take over assets and business operations from its predecessor, Westinghouse Digital Electronics LLC,<ref>[http://www.groklaw.net/pdf2/SFCvBestBuy-134.pdf Memorandum of law in support of plaintiffs motion to join successors in interest of defendant Westinghouse Digital Electronics, LLC] groklaw.com, 08/09/2010</ref><ref>[http://www.softwarefreedom.org/resources/2010/2010-06-03-Motion_against_Westinghouse.pdf Motion by Software Freedom Conservancy against Westinghouse] CMA letter, page 40</ref> which is currently in the process of [[general assignment]], a [[State of California]] alternative to [[bankruptcy]].
The former Westinghouse Digital Electronics LLC, founded in 2003,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=7683489 |title=Westinghouse Digital Electronics, LLC: Private Company Information - BusinessWeek |publisher=Investing.businessweek.com |date= |accessdate=2010-08-30}}</ref> at one time reached #4 market position in the USA<ref>[http://news.cnet.com/Westinghouse-plugs-in-to-LCD-TVs---page-3/2008-1041_3-6152274-3.html Cnet interviews WDE president Douglas Woo (2007)]</ref> by offering high-feature products at aggressive prices and is notable for having marketed one of the first [[1080p]]-ready [[HDTV]] monitors.<ref>[http://reviews.cnet.com/flat-panel-tvs/westinghouse-lvm-37w1/4505-6482_7-31386643.html Cnet reviews Westinghouse LVM-37W1] cnet.com, 2005-08-17</ref><ref>[http://www.highdefforum.com/flat-panel-tvs/19934-westinghouses-lvm-37w1-lcd-tv.html Westinghouse's LVM-37W1 LCD TV] highdefforum.com, 2006-01-13</ref>
As of 2009, Westinghouse Digital also partners with AdtekMedia/PumpTop TV to provide LCD screens for the delivery of advertising content to U.S. service-station customers.<ref>[http://www.pumptoptv.com/ajax/news.php?id=20090908 AdtekMedia/PumpTop TV press release] pumptoptv.com, 09/08/2009</ref>
